body:
Sorry - meant to include a link to the applet (which contains a scroll pane): 
 
http://lafros.com/demos/gui/tabs/1.1/tabsDemo.html 
 
On Sat, May 22, 2010 at 2:17 PM, Rob Dickens wrote: 
> Thanks for mentioning this. I was particularly interested to see what 
> would happen here on my 32-bit MacBook, where I don't seem to have the 
> option of selecting the 'In their own process' preference--the radio 
> buttons are greyed-out--which appears to be required in order to avoid 
> the flickering seen on resizing the browser window. 
> 
> Lo and behold, there is no flicker! :-D 
> 
> However, on the downside, two-finger scrolling (inside the applet) is 
> not supported (as it is in Safari) :-( 
> 
> Rob 
> 
> On Sat, May 22, 2010 at 12:34 PM, David Leader 
> wrote: 
>> I don't think this was mentioned but the Mac beta of the Chrome browser will 
>> now run applets which I gather is dependent on this java upgrade. 
>> 
>> (Not that I am in any way suggesting Mac users should use anything other 
>> than Safari themselves, but if one produces web sites that contain Java 
>> applets it is obviously something which one has to be aware of.) 
>> 
>> David
